cont.entity_a: Efficient in transferring data from old drives to current storage technology.
cont.entity_b: Requires USB connection for initial recognition before using Firewire.

cont.entity_a: Affordable compared to external zip disk drives priced between $80-$200.
cont.entity_b: Large memory capacity for the price. Good value for the price with USB and Firewire cables included.

cont.entity_a: Arrived in excellent condition and works great.
Records files at a high speed.

cont.entity_b: Occasional issues with Windows XP shutdown. Suitable for both Mac and PC.

Software.comm: No installation needed, just plug and play.

cont.entity_b: Pre-installed software can be removed and reinstalled if needed.

cont.entity_a: Uses 750MB capacity disks, suitable for smaller file backups.
cont.entity_b: 500GB space sufficient for photos, music, and movies. Large storage capacity at a reasonable price.

cont.entity_a: USB cord is appreciated for easy data transfer.
cont.entity_b: Stylish and modern design. Compact and fits well on a desk.

cont.entity_a: No longer has web support from Iomega.
Dependable and fast performance over years of use.
cont.entity_b: Reliable and silent operation. Heats up during heavy use. Unstable at times, data loss possible.
Failed to complete backups after a year of use.

cont.entity_a: Product works well for reading old backed up emails and ZIP100 data.
cont.entity_b: Useful for backing up iTunes and iPhotos via Firewire. Dual interface provides versatility.

cont.entity_a: Great for storage of smaller documents.
cont.entity_b: Easy to use with dual interface. External hard drive is easy to set up and use.
Vibrates noticeably, may require a rubber isolation pad. Lacks a cooling fan but operates quietly.
